attributes.additional_details: The marginalised will be constrained even more to either go without or seek food banks.many customers will be unable to afford the expense of travelling to Tesco out of town superstores seeking lower prices and impossible for the disabled.HMGov should consider as in Scotland a travel pass that embraces a companion addition eg carers.
attributes.background: Insist on the largest food retailer to act in the public interest at a time when prices were increasing anyway as this will only encourage competitors to follow suit thus adding to inflation

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or House of Commons is responsible for.

Decisions about what stores to retain and how to structure these are a matter for individual retailers, not the Government or House of Commons.

As a result it is not possible for the Government or House of Commons to take the action you have requested.
